noun.description: The subject of a talk, a piece of writing, a person's thoughts, or an exhibition; a topic.
examples: the theme of the sermon was reverence
a show on the theme of waste and recycling

noun.description: An idea that recurs in or pervades a work of art or literature.
A setting given to a leisure venue or activity, intended to evoke a particular country, historical period, culture, etc.
examples: a family fun park with a western theme

noun.description: The stem of a noun or verb; the part to which inflections are added, especially one composed of the root and an added vowel.
Any of the twenty-nine provinces in the Byzantine empire.

verb.description: Give a particular setting or ambience to (a venue or activity)
examples: the amusement park will be themed as a Caribbean pirate stronghold

origin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin thema, from Greek, literally proposition; related to tithenai to set or place.
